required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Smoking on Dimensional Changes of Free Gingival Graft Around Dental Implants
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Smoking on Dimensional Changes of Free Gingival Graft Around Dental Implants

brief_summary.textblock: There are studies investigating the dimensional changes following free gingival graft (FGG) around teeth with inadequate attached gingiva, however no study investigating the effect of smoking on dimensional changes following FGG around dental implants exists. In the present study, we hypothesized that smoking might increase the dimensional change of FGG around dental implants and affect the healing of donor site.

primary_outcome.measure: dimensional change of free gingival graft
primary_outcome.description: the changes in vertical dimension of free gingival graft was measured by functional and visual methods intra-orally by individual stents, and horizontal dimension of free gingival graft was measured on digital photographs using specific software.

primary_outcome.measure: change in total free gingival graft area
primary_outcome.description: total free gingival graft area was calculated on digital photographs using specific software.

secondary_outcome.measure: tissue thickness of recipient and donor sites

arm_group.description: Those consuming at least 10 cigarette a day for ten years were included in smoker group.
Patients who never smoke were included in non-smoker group. Patients who quit smoking were not included in this group.

intervention.description: Following recipient site preparation, free gingival graft obtained from palatal mucosa was applied to buccal sites of dental implants having inadequate keratinized attached mucosa.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Implants with inadequate attached gingiva on the buccal site, which placed in posterior region at least 1 year ago, and loaded with a fixed prosthetic restoration at least 6 months ago.
Exclusion Criteria:
Implants with peri-implantitis, patients who had previously the soft or hard tissue graft surgery at the site in question, patients who had previously operated from the donor site, patients with systemic disease that may interfere with periodontal surgery, patients taking any medication that can prolong bleeding, patients with immune system disease, infectious diseases such as hepatitis or HIV, individuals under the age of 18, and women with pregnant or breastfeeding.
